meanings.sent1: The skilled hunter was able to outhunt all his competitors.
meanings.sent2: She always manages to outhunt the other hunters in the forest.
meanings.sent3: The clever fox decided to outhunt the hunters by hiding in a bush.
meanings.sent4: His determination to outhunt his prey was as fierce as a lion's roar.
meanings.sent5: With stealth and patience, he planned to outhunt the elusive deer.

meanings.definition: To hunt more successfully than others.
meanings.sent1: The experienced tracker knew how to outhunt any rival in the woods.
meanings.sent2: During the competition, she aimed to outhunt her opponents and claim the prize.
meanings.sent3: The raccoon thought it could outhunt the humans by sneaking into their camp.
meanings.sent4: Her determination to outhunt the pack of wolves was unwavering.
meanings.sent5: The predator's instinct to outhunt its prey was ingrained in its nature.
